name: Nana’s Pastina 🥗
description: For many, pastina is a nostalgic childhood memory. This traditional Italian recipe varies slightly depending on region and preference, but one thing stays the same — it’s a simple dish that’s ideal when you want a cozy and comforting meal.
instructions: In a large pot, add the broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the pastina to the boiling broth and stir gently. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 5-7 minutes, until the pastina is tender and most of the broth is absorbed. You want it to be brothy.
Stir the butter into the cooked pastina, then remove from heat and quickly whisk in the beaten egg until incorporated.
Add the cheese and stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon into serving bowls. Garnish with cheese and drizzle with olive oil.
